reviews.review_msg: Ian loves to travel, and his power points show. He is very friendly and upbeat, but has trouble explaining terms at times... He is unorganized as well. He needs to slow down, and give more time for students to copy the slides. Good guy, and I think he will become a good professor with more practice.

Alison is obviously dedicated to her field of interest, and is very kind and receptive... unfortunately her ambition in tourism studies has allowed her to only see the quantitative perspectives. Thus she neglects a huge and important field of study within tourism. relatively easy course but I don't believe that you gain much which defeats the purpo

Lectures very boring, but provides slides ahead of time and lectures are recorded.  She has a high interest level, but can be hard to understand at times.  Study lecture notes REAL hard, know all of the details, and be able to write an essay on the simplest questions you might think of.  Can be hard if you don't put the time into studying.

This class might be boring at times, but it's not hard. Alison showed great interest in teaching. All of her lectures are recorded and are avaliable online. She's a great prof. TA was awesome. Markings were fair.
LECTURE=BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORING         TUTORIAL=BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORING  MARKING=WAY TOO HARD  basically this class sucks

Her Lectures were so boring and dry, but the good thing is that you don't have to go to lectures to do well in her class.  All you need are her ppt. slides, study them and you will do fine!! (IAN is the BEST TA!!!)
Her lectures are so boring!! Hard to stay awake! The only thing that made this class barable was a great TA. IAN ROCKED!!

The textbook was dry and boring-what took 20 pages to say could have been said in 5 pages. The midterm was not that bad but the final exam was the hardest final I have EVER written-I'm suprised I came out of the final exam alive! AVOID!!!!!!
one of the most difficult profs/classes i've taken.  midterm and final were brutal.
I really enjoyed this class. The switch to online was a bit tricky at first but I found that in all of my classes. I would recommend this prof and class to my friends.

Patrick came across as a very nice and caring prof but did not end up living up to first impressions. He provided zero feedback on any assignment, marked unfairly, took a very long time to return deliverables, and did not respect students time. He dropped the ball during the change to online classes, and provided very little communication.
